presentation.title: As a developer, have you ever found it difficult to...
presentation.question1: Feel legitimate in the tech world?
presentation.question4: Get motivated to keep developing your skills?

why.bigText: Let‚Äôs smash the impostor syndrome together!
why.bullet1: For the developers with no engineering degree, who don‚Äôt take computers to pieces every weekend and didn‚Äôt start coding when they were 5
why.bullet2: Made with love by feminist, queer, inclusive devs and other fucking friendly people
why.bullet3: An open source and 100% free platform
why.bullet4: A dashing newsletter, already praised by the Tech world for its accessible and decomplexing contents

header.bigText: At Electronic Tales we want to make computer culture human readable.
header.middleText: i.e. within the reach of everyone.
header.littleText: To do so, we sat, <strike>ate toasts with slightly salted butter,</strike> we thought, we sketched out main lines (and hatched concepts).

id1.text: Building a safe space for peer support between devs

id2.text: Helping devs to strengthen their software and hardware skills

id3.text: Analysing and deciphering the geek culture codes

id4.text: Motivating devs to keep learning alongside their job

id1.text: Evening classes and workshops, online and in real

id2.text: A Slack with hundreds of friendly members

id3.text: Micro-learning, storytelling, sandbox ‚Äì to learn everywhere without ZzzZ

id4.text: Cool contents in your mail box

form.error500: Oops... Something went wrong on the server side. Try again or contact us.
form.waitAMinute: Wait a sec... What will happen to me if I give you my email?

id1.desc: You receive an email giving you a link to our Slack, the safe space where devs communicate in a kindly way. Also, you are subscribed to our newsletter, a dashing missive already praised by the Tech world for its contents.

id2.desc: You become a member of the Electronic Tales co-creators‚Äô pool... in other words, a member of the Team! It means that you can, if you wish so, add Electronic Tales as work experience on &Co.

id3.desc:
Fear not!

Actually, we are not going to ask you to write a series of astoundingly deep articles about z-index in CSS or to code a dark-theme for irs.gov.

You will see, it is very simple!

id4.desc: On a regular basis, but not too often, we will write you to ask you some questions of the utmost importance (e.g. which one of these designs do you prefer, which topics would interest you, etc.). Answering it will never take you more than five minutes. And if you feel a lack of inspiration, you can write us to tell us our questions are stupid (or you can just not answer at all).

id5.desc: We will owe you eternal gratitude.
id5.question: So, ready to go?

id2.name: Monday Hazard
id2.desc: Was today years old when she realized code breeding was cool.

id3.name: Le Crampon
id3.desc: If the Start-Up Nation had a face, it would be his.
